greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=a(|n-a(n-3)|)+a(|n-a(n-4)|) for n>3, a(n)=1 otherwise.
comment: The sequence is defined only for n <= 866, see example. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 21 2012

Sequence A064552 is defined in terms of this one. It is not immediate to see whether the sequence really is undefined or rather only implicitely defined for n>866. [It seems a priori conceivable to me that the given relation might be satisfied for a unique choice of all a(n).] - _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 28 2012
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, full Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..866
program: a064657_list = map fromJust $ takeWhile (/= Nothing) zs where
| otherwise       = Just $ z (abs (x - i3)) + z (abs (x - i4))
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Oct 08 2001
ext: Keyword fini added by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 21 2012
